name: Barn Joo 35
address: 34 W 35th St, New York, NY 10001, USA

reviews.text: Great ambiance, amazing food and super friendly service! I know the corn is a side dish but it's amazing! Bulgogi, spicy pork and fish toe rice were all authentic and tasty. Highly recommended!

This place was great! Super friendly staff, truly authentic food (I am Korean btw) - highly recommended!!!
ìŒì‹ ë§›ìˆêµ¬ ë„ˆë¬´ ì¹œì ˆí•˜ì„¸ìš” ê°•ì¶”ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤!! ğŸ‘
Great atmosphere and service.
Holy holy goodness!  What a fantastic place!  Claire and Jay are unbelievable hosts!  Loved the food and the scene was incredible!
Excellent service! The food is great!
so kind and drinks were really good!
Just the meal I needed with smiling service
So amazing and the team was very warm and welcoming. Will come back!
For the price you pay, food is not okay. $37 for a spicy pork... rice menus are fine but not worth $24. Also platter menu does not exist.

The first Korean restaurant Iâ€™ve ever been to where I wasnâ€™t served the traditional Banchan. Apparently thatâ€™s a lunch thing? Service good and atmosphere ok, but only 2 stars for the lack of sides. Theyâ€™re my favourite thing about Korean cuisine..
The food was very good. We ate supper on a Monday evening & walked in. No reservation.
Overpriced and underseasoned. Go almost anywhere else, save yourself the headache.
The waitress Mai was sweet. Good for happy hour!
Excellent service. Made us feel comfortable. Our server May was great
The katsu set is simple and filling. Quick service.
Food was good. I highly recommend to try this place.

Greeted at door with attentive and pleasant energy was seated quickly and waited on promptly. The food came out fast, and the drinks were well spoken about; all in all a very five out of five experience. Claire showed great hospitality and was a great host. She was kind and we appreciated her so.

I booked my reservation wrong but the manager was able to accommodate my party anyways. Food was amazing service was fast even though they were super busy. Drinks were great highly recomment the soju flight the lychee was my favorite.

We went to Barn Joe 35 on a Tuesday around 6 p.m. without a reservation and got seated right away at a table for two. The place is small but cozy â€” it feels welcoming and not overcrowded, which I really liked.

The menu has a good amount of options â€” enough to choose from without feeling overwhelming. We started with the chicken bites, which were super good: crispy, came out hot, and had a nice spicy sauce. For the mains, we had beef bibimbap and bulgogi â€” both were delicious and really hit the spot. I also tried one of their drinks, which was tasty and a bit unique.

They do have a happy hour, but it ends early (around 5 p.m.), so we missed it. Prices are pretty typical for Manhattan: appetizers around $15-$20, mains around $24-$30, and drinks about $20.

The vibe is relaxed and pleasant, the service was friendly and quick, and everything we ordered tasted great.

Overall, Iâ€™d give Barn Joe 35 a solid 5/5 â€” cozy spot with good food, good service, and a nice atmosphere. Would definitely recommend!
We got some food here one night and ordered a bunch of different items to share among us. The food was a bit spicy but also had a lot of flavor. Their meat was especially really good.

Great food but service is awful. We had to ask for serving spoon, napkin etc. The waitress looked angry the whole time (just one of them) but enough to give me an awful experience. When I look at the server's face,.you can tell she does not want to be there at ALL.

Outstanding serving and the highest food quality. Meticulously prepared dishes we enjoyed for dinner. Also nice there was no wait for a table. Would have loved to see more kimchi in the menu otherwise great. Would totally come back
Tasty and nicely served Korean place. Recommended.
The food and drinks were pretty good. The corn on one of the main entrees tasted kind of off? but the staff was very generous and accommodating

Das Essen war perfekt!
Der Service super aufmerksam und nett!
2 Tequila gab es umsonst ğŸ˜€
Leckeres Essen, freundlicher Service, gutes Preis-LeistungsverhÃ¤ltnis. Wir waren sogar 2x hier essen.

Love this place here! Food was amazing and the manager was super sweet and gave us a bingsoo on the house because he noticed it was my birthday.  Love the attentive care and the hospitality they have!! 10/10 would come again

My mom and I were there last night to celebrate her birthday!
Just wanted to say how amazing the food is! 10/10
The service was amazing the staff is very friendly and attentive with us. 10/10
We just wanted to take the time to give a shoutout to I believe was the manager? but he was amazing! He made sure my mom felt very special on her birthday yesterday!! Super wonderful
Thank you so much for taking extra care of us yesterday we truly appreciate all you did thank you!!! â˜ºï¸â˜ºï¸ will definitely be visiting again soon!
service was so good! Alan was so attentive and made this experience 10/10

Food was really good. They have a good happy hour drink selection. You can spin the wheel to win prizes when booking a reservation!!
One of the best service. Our server checked in on our party multiple times and explained how to properly eat each dish to us.
The vibes were great. Pretty spacious (upstairs too).

Made reservations here on a whim while visiting the city with family from out of the country. Itâ€™s a great little place with wonderful food that is perfect for hanging out after work or a casually meeting with friends.

If you make a reservation you get to spin a little wheel for a prize. We won free soju shots which was nice. We ordered a bunch of apps to share which I feel is the way to go here. We had the fried veggie dumplings, bulgogi tacos, shrimp tempura roll, soy garlic wings, and popcorn chicken. Everything was very tasty. If I had to nit pick iâ€™d say the bulgogi tacos could have been better. They tasted like regular beef tacos and should have had more of a bulgogi flavor profile.
But the fried foods were hot a crispy, the sushi was fresh, and the portions were a great size.

The restaurant was quite busy on a random Wednesday evening in the summer so Iâ€™d recommend getting a reservation to be safe, however it seemed many people were walk ins.
Super cuisine, service trÃ¨s agrÃ©able au top
Amazing food and Janice really made the experience so good. Plus the drinks are really good.

A solid spot with tender beef and pork, good flavors and friendly staff. This is a place to make sure you donâ€™t miss. Especially the lunch special with ample Banchan and make sure to try their refreshing cucumber soju drink!
Also you get to spin a wheel if you have a reservation for a chance to win a drink or item!!

Absolutely loved this spot! The presentation was beautiful fresh lettuce wraps, colorful salads, juicy grilled meats, and a rainbow flight of drinks that were as fun as they were refreshing. Great portion sizes and such a fun vibe overall.
I just came in here for a quick meal. The seafood stew was delicious, accompanied by the nice Korean beer. I just wish there were some side dishes like other Korean places while waiting

The dishes here were super good. I enjoyed the soy garlic dumplings, wooooow. I always had soy garlic chicken but never dumplings. It was super crispy on the outside. I liked the truffle fries as well. We also got the buns and tacos. The tacos were very interesting but i enjoyed it. My fav thing on the menu is the uni bibimbap, woooow!! I would come back just for this. Itâ€™s only $28 as well. I donâ€™t know what they added inside but it had crunch but I loved it. The galbi jjim was so good. Another mention is the soju cocktail flight, if you wanted to try all the signature cocktails, there you go! I loooved the cucumber cooler. One of my favs. They have plenty of space upstairs and downstairs. Our server Janice was super sweet as well! Would 100% come back.
Good but tbh kind of overpriced and no banchan :(
Food is decent. Happy hour wings are great for the price.
This is one of my favorite places to go to have a nice meal with friends. The food is always so good. I'm never disappointed
Great taste. And great guy Byoung thank you

Love, love, love!! Hot stone Spicy pork, Galbi, & Binsoo!  Recommend especially to my fellow Brosesâ€¦you know who you are! @Woosung, @Dijoon, @Hajoon, @ Jaehyeong! Itâ€™s a must visit when you get hereâ€¦ğŸ™ğŸ¼â¤ï¸ğŸŒ¹
Celebrated my daughter's birthday here. The staff was attentive, friendly, sang happy birthday with a decadent dessert. Food fresh, hot, delicious. Thank you for great experience
Fire
This place was amazing, I recommend it 100%! Drinks were amazing and our server,Gun, was really kind! Will come here again :)
Excellent food! Everything tasted sooo good!
Very tasty, generous portions, and good service.
loved the vibes and food!
Excellent customer service and loved the food. Would come back for the wings!
Very very good

It was nice for one-time experience but Iâ€™m not sure if I would like to revisit. I liked it but didnâ€™t like it that much for foods and drinks.

From tofu & kimchi menu, tofu was very nice cause it had perfect crispness and amazing spicy flavor. However, due to its spicy sauce on it, it canâ€™t go together with kimchi cause spicy + spicy just doesnâ€™t make sense. So it was confusing as a menu. Typical Korean way of tofu & kimchi menu is served with tofu in its original white and soft form.

Cocktails were bit off to my palate. They were generally all too sweat.

I'm coming alone and tilting a glass of soju with stir-fried spicy pork.
It's good to have spicy pork and earthen pot rice.
Considering that it's New York, it's not expensive, and even if you go alone, they kindly guide you. I recommend it.

This Korean restaurant is one of my favorites! The food is always amazing â€” I love every dish and honestly canâ€™t even pick a favorite. The vibes are great and fun, though it can get pretty crowded during dinner. One of the coolest things is their fancy cocktail flight with four different flavors, each served in a glass that lights up â€” such a fun and unique touch! Totally worth a visit every time.

We stopped by to escape the rainy day and found ourselves delighted by the Galbi-jjim. The beef was quite tender and the supplemental vegetables were well prepared. The corn was a bit starchy, but was nice with the sauce. The shrimp was seasoned well.
The restaurant was on the loud side, so it was occasionally difficult to hear people at our table

One of the better Korean restaurants around 35th, and a great alternative if you donâ€™t want to wait 45+ minutes at Cho Dang Gol. Though the place is called Barn Joo, I didnâ€™t try their alcohol. Their uni bowl is a standout â€” $26 for that much uni in NYC is a rare find, and the combination of ingredients in the bowl is flavorful and balanced. The interior shows a bit of age but is cozy and atmospheric, with a bar thatâ€™s well-stocked and a kitchen in clear view. Service is quick and attentive, from order to water refills. Walk-in seating is usually manageable, which makes it an even easier recommendation.

Authentic Korean fare including bibimbap and grilled meats. Good service, short waiting time and fair prices (considering the location, almost in the heart of Manhattan). The spicy pork bowl was not too spicy, so if you are sensitive to heat no need to worry. We had some chicken wings as appetizers, which were decent as well. Good selection of Korean and Japanese alcohols (they even had nigori-zake!).

Service was great, and the ambience was good! But the food, to me, was a bit too much â€˜Americanizedâ€™. Seafood pancake was deep fried- personally not a fan of that. It could be more appealing to people who prefer â€˜deep friedâ€™ crunchy umami flavor!

Barn Joo 35 is a great Korean place to go for dinner. Everything was beautifully presented.

The restaurant is small, but the atmosphere is modern, with a stylish vibe.

Iâ€™d recommend making a reservation beforeha d to ensure you get a table without a long wait.

uni bimbimbap was incredible but "beef bourguignon" had a subtle sweetness where it should've been savory. decent limeade. will def be back to form my fuller opinion on the restaurant+j to try more of their food if the bimbimbap was an indicator on their overall quality

waitress had a friendly disposition, chill atmosphere

My husbands coworker recommended this place by someone who used to live in the area.

We went for lunch and the food was so delicious and plenty to eat.

The service was a little slow, the kitchen bed how to come out and greet/sit us, not sure where the hostess was.

Highly recommend and must try!

This Korean restaurant is a chill place to grab some Korean food and drinks with friends. The interior of this location is pretty relaxed, with lots of tables, and a casual vibe. Service was super kind.

If you make reservations here then you get to spin their wheel for something free, which I thought was a cool thing that they did! (We got free soju shots) My friend and I ordered their fried tofu, seafood pancake, spicy chicken, and budaejjigae. The first tofu and spicy chicken were pretty solid. We both thought that the seafood pancake and budaejjigae were okay. The seafood pancake was very bready, and didn't have much seafood in it, so we were a bit disappointed. And, we thought that the budaejjigae leaned on the sweet side, which was alright. Overall, I thought that it was a decent spot but if I wanted this style of Korean food and drinks, I think there are pocha spots that are better.

Delicious Korean style tapas. The seafood pancake was pricey and I donâ€™t think itâ€™s worth it, but besides that, everything I had was good. Love the mushroom and shishito pepper. The crispy tofu was a pleasant surprise. Pork, potato, and rice cake was delicious. Buns were also good. Service was good. I am looking forward to coming back to try more things ğŸ˜Š

This place is so good. Korean tapas and cocktails were amazing. Staff are so attentive and they dint charge for the dessert as we celebrated my friendâ€™s birthday. So kind Manager. If you are in midtown and try some tapas this is the place for you. Iâ€™m already planning to come back again.

We had a great experience here overall. We went during happy hour and ordered a few items on the happy hour menu and some regular ones as well.

There was a little confusion when we ordered corn cheese (not on the happy hour menu). The server must have heard something else (crunchy tofu?) and thought we ordered it on the happy hour menu. It arrived at our table (I have a photo of it) and we let them know it was not what we ordered.

We didn't touch it and they did take it off our bill, but only after we insisted that it was not what we ordered.

We got a couple of their soju cocktails as well. Both were delicious. Food was pretty good, too.

It's been awhile since I've been here but never forgot it. Great food and service.  Friends wanted Korean food and knew this was the spot. The galbi meat is recommended if you like beef so tender.  All with me loved the food. Will have to go back sooner.

This location is really nice. My friends and I had a reservation and I got here on time. My friends were running a little late, but they accommodated and let me sit at the table to wait for them. I like the upstairs area. Itâ€™s very roomy. The food is good and came on time! The drinks are really good too. We got the Soju cocktail flights and it was good!

If you want traditional Korean food, this place wonâ€™t be a good choice. Foods are more like fancy but small portion fusion foods. Overall the taste is a bit sweet. The uni bibimbap is a good choice!

This place has a cool vibe and chill atmosphere. Perfectly dimmed lighting and love the rustic style. The bulgogi hotstone bowl is delicious! Careful thoâ€¦ as the name implies, the stone bowl is HOT! Would definitely come back! Hit the spot!

I had such an amazing time introducing my friend to Korean food for the first time here! The menu offered a variety of delicious options, and every dish was packed with flavor. We left feeling full, satisfied, and so happy with our experience. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, making it the perfect spot to share a meal. Highly recommend for anyone looking to try unique Korean cuisine!

Went for dinner with my family to celebrate my sonâ€™s birthday. No wait time, we were seated right away. The food were amazing. Loved everything we ordered. Sadly couldnâ€™t try the soju cocktails but definitely going back for those. The place itself is nice & cozy. Service was great. Would recommend.

Korean gastronomy? Love it. Where kimchi meets french fries! We went fur lunch, When I first came in, they made me spin the wheel of Fortune and it landed on  free french fries! Yay!  The portions are huge. I had the ssam galbi and it came with lettuce cup soup, side dish, rice, and Galbi of course.  I couldnâ€™t finish it so I had to take half home. We all had different things so it was nice to taste. Iâ€™ll definitely come back! Iâ€™m
Hungry just looking at the photos! Service was friendly & courteous.

Adorable, intimate, Delicious, friendly. These would be the four word I would use to describe Barn Joo 35. We had a party of 6 at 8pm on a Saturday and didnâ€™t have reservations but the staff got a table together for us in the blink of an eye. The restaurant is quaint and has a lovely atmosphere. The rear open kitchen concept allows you to see whatâ€™s happening or focus on your own party. The food was outstanding. And the kitchen prepares and brings everything out family style. But everyone had food within 5 minutes of the first dish being dropped off. Perfect levels of spice and heat. I highly recommend the seafood Japche as an entrÃ©e and the shishito peppers and mushrooms as an appetizer. Samantha was an amazing server, but the entire staff was so friendly and helpful. 10/10 will be returning.

We got a mix of different dishes. We started off with the seafood pancake which was ok but not a lot of seafood and seemed like it was primarily veggies (a lot of onions). We also got the tacos and they were ok as well. I liked the lil salsa that came along with it. It was a bit of a chilly night so we got the Korean army stew as our main dish and it was super filling with tofu, sausage, and noodles. The truffle fries were also delicious! I would go back for the fries alone! Overall, it was good but would probably skip the seafood pancake and the tacos and try other items next time!

Alright, so this spot is kinda tucked away, which is cool. They've got a decent-sized bar and plenty of tables. We had to wait a bit, but just grabbed drinks at the bar and ordered some apps. Perfect. We got somaek (beer and soju, if you don't know), seafood pancakes, wings, truffle fries, and dumplings. Honestly, the wings were the absolute winner. Like, those soy garlic wings? Crispy as anything, and just...delicious. The pancake was packed with stuff, and those crispy edges? So good. Fries and dumplings were solid, no complaints. And man, the staff was on it. It was crazy busy, but they kept everything running smooth. You know how it is on a weekend. Seriously, good vibes all around.

KOREAN TAPAS & SOJU COCKTAIL FLIGHTS = A Perfect Date night idea

We loved exploring the menu here including the  Galbi, Bulgogi HOTSTONE Bowl, the softshell crab, the Korean fried chicke and tasting all the flavors in that SoJu flight â€” my fave is Passionfruit.

Had an excellent time at Barn Joo 35. I've enjoyed the Korean tapas concept at Danji before and Barn Joo doesn't disappoint either!

We had the Seafood Pancake, Steamed Veggie dumpling, and Barn Joo Salad and greatly enjoyed all of them a lot. The lemonade with its glowing light in the glass was a nice touch. The ambience is excellent and the service was amazing. Overall, highly recommend!

Went on a Monday evening- the restaurant was full! Luckily found a table. Ordered the soju drink- nothing exciting. For apps we ordered the dumplings and truffle fries. The dumplings were good, truffle fries average. Main course- veggie japche - exceptional! Loved every spoon of it; tofu and mushroom hot stone bowl- yummy, just loved the way tofu was cooked, melted in the mouth! Overall, great service, good food!
